class data.BinaryDataFormat[source]¶

BinaryDataFormat inherits form DataFormat class and defined all kind of binary files.

convert(data)[source]¶

convert method creates a new object with the same value as the input but in a binary data format.

Parameters:data (not defined specifically.) – the value to be converted into binary data format.
Returns:create a new object from data converted in a BinaryDataFormat format.
Return type:Data object
get_data_type()[source]¶

get_data_type method returns the data type associated to a BinaryDataFormat.

Returns:The data type associated to this data format.
Return type:string
validate(value)[source]¶

validate controls if a value is a binary file or not.

Parameters:value (not defined specifically. Could be anything.) – the value to be controled.
Returns:True if the value parameter is a binary file False otherwise.
Return type:boolean
class data.CollectionData(list_of_data=None)[source]¶

CollectionData is a class that stores and manipulates a set of Data of a kind.

__init__(list_of_data=None)[source]¶
Parameters:list_of_data (array) – list of input Data objects.
data_type[source]¶
Returns:the data_type of a Data object.
Return type:string
class data.Data(data_format=None, value=None)[source]¶

Data is a class that stores and manipulates data. It’s composed by two parameters: one data format and one value.

__init__(data_format=None, value=None)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • data_format (DataFormat) – the identifier name of the data format
  • value (not defined specifically. Could be anything.) – the value associated to the data
data_format[source]¶
Returns:the data_format of a Data object.
Return type:DataFormat
data_type[source]¶
Returns:the data_type of a Data object.
Return type:DataType
value[source]¶
Returns:the value associated to the dataType.
Return type:not defined specifically. could be anything.
class data.DataFormat[source]¶

DataFormat is an abstract class that defines the format of a data.

__metaclass__¶

alias of ABCMeta

__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

convert(data)[source]¶

convert is defined in each DataFormat‘s subclasses. This method creates a new object with the same value as the input but in another data format.

Parameters:data (not defined specifically.) – the value to be converted into another data format.
get_data_type()[source]¶

get_data_type is defined in each DataFormat‘s subclasses. This method returns the data type associated to a DataFormat.

validate(value)[source]¶

validate is defined in each DataFormat‘s subclasses. This method controls if a value is in the right data format or not.

Parameters:value (not defined specifically. Could be anything.) – the value to be controled.
class data.DataType[source]¶

DataType is an abstract class that defines the type of a Data.

__metaclass__¶

alias of ABCMeta

__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

check(value)[source]¶

check is an abstract method defined in each DataType‘s subclasses. This method controls if a value really belongs to a DataType.

Parameters:value (not defined specifically. Could be anything.) – the value to be controled.
get_formats()[source]¶

get_formats is an abstract method defined in each DataType‘s subclasses. This method returns all formats available for a DataType.

class data.EDAMDataType(EDAM_id=None)[source]¶

EDAMDataType is a class that inherits from DataType and contains data types defined in EDAM ontology (http://edamontology.org/).

__init__(EDAM_id=None)[source]¶
Parameters:EDAM_id (integer) – EDAM ontology identifier.
check(value)[source]¶

check method controls if a value really belongs to an EDAMDataType.

Parameters:value (not defined specifically. Could be anything.) – the value to be controled.
Returns:True if the value parameter is an EDAMDataType False otherwise.
Return type:boolean
get_formats()[source]¶

get_formats method returns all formats available for an EDAMDataType. Remark: results must be read in a database.

Returns:the data_formats of an EDAMDataType object.
Return type:string array
class data.IntegerDataFormat[source]¶

IntegerDataFormat inherits form SimpleDataFormat class and defined Integers.

convert(data)[source]¶

convert method creates a new object with the same value as the input but in another data format.

Parameters:data (not defined specifically.) – the value to be converted into another data format.

Return type:string
validate(value)[source]¶

Parameters:value (not defined specifically. Could be anything.) – the value to be controled.
Returns:True if the value parameter is an integer False otherwise.
Return type:boolean
class data.IntegerDataType[source]¶

IntegerDataType is a class that inherits from SimpleDataType and contains all values of Integer type.

__init__()[source]¶

Defines _data_format parameter as an IntegerDataFormat object.

check(value)[source]¶

check method controls if a value really belongs to IntegerDataType (ie, is an integer).

Parameters:value (not defined specifically. Could be anything.) – the value to be controled.
Returns:True if the value parameter is an integer False otherwise.
Return type:boolean

class data.SimpleDataType[source]¶

class data.StructData(input_dict=None)[source]¶

StructData is a class that stores and manipulates structure of data. It’s composed by a set of Data of any kinds.

__getitem__(key)[source]¶
Parameters:key (string) – name of the parameter in the dictionary
Returns:the value associated to the key.
Return type:not defined specifically. Could be anything.
__init__(input_dict=None)[source]¶
Parameters:input_dict (python dictionary (ex: dict = { ‘zero’: 0, ‘one’: 1, ‘two’: 2 })) – dictionary that contains input names and values of the structure
class data.TextDataFormat[source]¶

TextDataFormat inherits form DataFormat class and defined all kind of text files.
